summary: This bill mandates the Secretary of the Treasury to designate certain foreign entities, defined as those engaging in fraudulent activities targeting U.S. citizens and lawful permanent residents to obtain assets, as "Foreign Financial Threat Organizations." These designated organizations face asset freezes, penalties, and procedures similar to those of designated terrorist organizations. The bill also includes provisions for preventing contact with U.S. citizens/residents and requires annual reports to Congress regarding implementation, assets seized, and actions taken.
